digital_hording.title: Why Deleting Files Feels Like Deleting Memories
digital_hording.description:
Do you have thousands of screenshots you’ll never watch or old emails you’re afraid to delete?
In this video, we dive into digital hoarding—the excessive accumulation and reluctance to delete digital files, from photos to documents.

We explore:
• Fear of Loss: The anxiety that you might need a piece of information later.
• Sentimental Attachment: How digital files carry emotional weight.
• Identity Preservation: Why deleting files can feel like erasing a part of yourself.
• Decision Paralysis: How data overload causes procrastination and overwhelm.

Digital files don’t take physical space, but they create mental clutter, reduce productivity, and increase security risks.
Learn how psychological ownership and digital object attachment blur the line between your offline and digital identities.

phantom_buzz.title: How Your Brain Creates Fake Phone Vibrations (Neuroscience Breakdown)
phantom_buzz.description:
Have you ever sworn your phone buzzed, only to check and find nothing?
This is Phantom Pocket Vibration Syndrome.

What you’ll learn:
• Anticipatory Anxiety: Why our brain waits for notifications.
• Brain Chemistry: Cortisol, norepinephrine, and overstimulation.
• FOMO Response: Why missing messages feels threatening.
• Tech Anxiety: How constant checking increases stress and distraction.

Retraining the brain:
• Take 10-minute tech breaks every 90-120 minutes.
• Nature walks, meditation, exercise.
• Check messages on a schedule instead of compulsively.

Featuring insights from Dr. Michelle Drouin & Dr. Larry Rosen.

toxicity_online_gaming.title: Why High-Rank Players Bully Noobs: The Psychology No One Talks About
toxicity_online_gaming.description:
Why do high-rank players bully new players, and what does 'griefing' do to our brains?
This video breaks down Self-Determination Theory (SDT) to show how toxic behavior impacts autonomy, competence, and relatedness.

Key insights:
• The Griefer's High: Power, control, and emotional reward.
• The Smurfing Paradox: Why players cheat for easier matches.
• Need Frustration: How harassment destroys connection and wellbeing.

This isn’t just gameplay — it’s psychology.
